titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.repository: The Historical Society of Pennsylvania 1300 Locust Street Philadelphia, PA 19107

bioghist.p: Mrs. Frederick E. Stow lived in Elkins Park, Pennsylvania.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of newspaper clippings related to members of the Daughters of the American Revolution and the organization (by and about), particularly the Quaker City Chapter, and applications for membership to various patriotic societies, including the Welcome Society, D.A.R., Pennsylvania Sons of the Revolution, and Pennsylvania Society of the Pilgrims (Mrs. Stows may have been a professional genealogist researching and submitting applications on behalf of others). There is a small amount of correspondence and copies of original documents related to surname research.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
